body: Building docker-compose services with a fresh clone reproduces the same issue.
@frankniujc Please update Node and npm version. After that, run `npm install` and `npm run build`.

@mapx The docker-compose issue may be linked to an outdated volume (we cache pip dependencies and node modules in a volume to make subsequent restarts faster). Could you try clearing the volumes (e.g. with `docker-compose down --volumes`) and try starting the stack again?
@Hironsan My node version is 8.10.0 and my npm version is 3.5.2

> @mapx The docker-compose issue may be linked to an outdated volume (we cache pip dependencies and node modules in a volume to make subsequent restarts faster). Could you try clearing the volumes (e.g. with `docker-compose down --volumes`) and try starting the stack again?

We met with the issue yesterday. There wasn't any cache volume before our first attempt, and we did remove all of them when we tried different configurations.

@mapx I can't reproduce the behavior you describe locally: everything works fine for me with doccano at ed2791ee with docker (latest version) on Windows 10 + WSL. Could you share a stacktrace and/or repro steps?
@frankniujc Did you solve the problem? If so, close this issue.
@Hironsan Yes. Upgrade npm to 6.9.1 and the problem is solved.

issue.title: npm run build failed with #247

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
Hi @Hironsan 

First, I am sorry about formatting this message, I will appreciate if you please can take a look at the issue.

I am having the same issue per #247 although I have the latest Node.js v13.11.0 & npm v6.13.7.
reinstalled the package and followed your instructions.

My environment is macOS catalina 15.3, Python3.8.2, venv, with Django 2.2.10, I am not using Docker, trying to get it working without.

serving on port 3000  with `dev-nuxt-run.sh` works fine. 

When I run `npm run build` at `app/server/static` I get this error:

```

npm ERR! A complete log of this run can be found in:

The terminal process terminated with exit code: 2
```


Django starts OK with:
```
source /Users/fatih/Desktop/Projects/AI/doccano/venv/bin/activate
echo "Starting Django Backend Server"

gunicorn --bind="0.0.0.0:${PORT:-8000}" --workers="${WORKERS:-1}" --pythonpath=app app.wsgi --timeout 300 
```


but then when I access to it assuming that i have a messed up nginx.conf to blame, it goes like this:
